meanings.definition: A slice of food that has been cut before serving.
meanings.sent1: I always enjoy the preslices of cake at parties.
meanings.sent2: The preslices of cheese were neatly arranged on the platter.
meanings.sent3: The preslices of watermelon looked like colorful jewels on the plate.
meanings.sent4: The preslices of bread were disappearing quickly at the buffet.
meanings.sent5: The preslices of pizza were a hit at the picnic.

meanings.definition: To cut food into slices before serving.
meanings.sent1: She preslices the vegetables for the stir-fry to save time later.
meanings.sent2: The chef preslices the meat to ensure even cooking.
meanings.sent3: He preslices the fruit with precision, like a culinary artist.
meanings.sent4: Preslicing the bread makes it easier to share with everyone.
meanings.sent5: Preslicing the cake allows for quick and easy serving.
